author: Staff Reporter
text:
Residents of Pillamanaickenpatti, Pugaiyilaipatti and Kosavapatti villages thronged the Collectorate here on Tuesday to return their ration cards in protest against the ban on jallikattu.

Condemning the “inaction” of the Central and State governments in according permission to conduct the rural sport, they said that people in 11 villages would boycott the Assembly elections if the governments failed to allow conduct of jallikattu. Later, officials convinced the villagers stating the issue was pending in the Supreme Court. The government would take all efforts to conduct jallikattu, they said and appealed to the protestors to wait for the court’s order and take back their ration cards, following which they dispersed.
title: Villagers threaten to return ration cards
